Reviews.Content: No frills, no joy No need to say again all the terrible things said by others. It is dingy, in need of some remodeling, and just feels dirty. I had two showers without hot water. The window air conditioner could not cool the room, and it just felt stuffy. The towels are thin and rough, the sheets feel old. The garbage truck woke me each morning, but that is not their fault. This hotel has the basics, but nothing more. There is a mildew-y smell throughout the hotel that could give some people with allergies a problem. Be fore-warned: this hotel is not near the water, it is near Wal-Mart, Sam's, Ala Moana Shopping Center, and Ross Dress for Less. If you are looking for beach view, easy walk to the beach, or the feel of winds flowing through your room this is not the place. The staff seemed courteous and efficient.
Reviews.Author: malawimike

Reviews.Content: BEDBUGS!!!!!! At first glance it seemed like an old but OK place to spend a couple of nights....location is great, Sam's  Wal-Mart at walking distance, until you make it inside the rooms to discover that they are dirty and poorly maintianed, bath tub was filthy and when taking a shower the water went from extremely cold to extremely hot all on its own.The worst happen the next morning when my daughters and I woke up full of bedbug bites all over our bodies. Bailed out of there like a smoking bandit!!
Reviews.Author: WATERBOY_8

Reviews.Content: Terrace suites need remodeling ASAP We did not stay or visit anyone staying at the Hotel Tower of this two buidling outfit. This review is based on our seven day stay in a two bedroom suite at their Terrace building.Our first suite on the second floor had a dead fridge and needed to be gutted and redone. Our second suite on the fourth floor wasn't much better but the fridge and A/C's worked. The flooring, carpeting, restroom, kitchenette and in-window A/C's had outlived their usable lifespans years ago. The suite was clean though. Their cleaning staff should be commended for the effort that they put in trying to make the rooms look presentable which is not easy considering the sad state of repair and upkeep that they are in. Unfortunately, there is there isn't enough lipstick in the island to make this pig look like anything but a pig. There were no bugs seen but the pigeons nesting outside our windows acting as our sunrise alarm every morning got to be a little annoying.Overall, our stay was not terrible since we were using the suite just as a place to sleep and shower.
Reviews.Author: RubiCrawlerLJ

Reviews.Content: Good Non-Resort Hotel The Pagoda Hotel doesn't show up in many guidebooks, but holds a nostalgic place in my mind because that's where my family stayed on our first trip to Hawaii, 35 years ago. This review, however, is based on a stay this year!The hotel is in Honolulu proper, a few blocks from the Ala Moana Shopping Center, but is not next to Waikiki -- one reason it seldom gets mentioned. For frequent visitors who don't need the full resort experience, though, it is more than adequate. The price, at least when booked through their web site, is excellent, and parking is plentiful (there's a charge, but a lot less than most other properties).There are two separate buildings -- the tower and the terrace. The terrace is actually across the street from the tower, which is connected to the check-in desk and the restaurant. I stayed in the tower, and found my room to be more than adequately large. I was impressed that there was a sink separate from the bathroom, which also had a sink, facilitating matters for those sharing the room with others. There were also a refrigerator, a microwave oven, and a safe -- all handy to have! Incidentally, each building has its own swimming pool, so no inconvenience there.Desk staff were friendly and efficient, as was the woman tending the shopette. I can't say that I had any interaction with other hotel staff.Shopette prices, by the way, are more than reasonable, quite a difference from even the mid-range properties in the US.The restaurant is renowned for its koi pond, for good reason. The pond surrounds the entire restaurant, and there are lots of tables at the windows and on a small lanai that allow views of the fish (or you can see them from the walkways outside). Feeding is scheduled for several times daily.For the daily breakfast buffet, the food is good but not spectacular. For the price, though, I'm not complaining. Sunday brunch (served after breakfast) and nightly dinner are also buffets, but I didn't partake this time. Hint: be sure to have reservations for dinner; I didn't eat dinner there because I didn't have a reservation and didn't want to wait 2 hours!I had a couple minor quibbles with the room. First, the plumbing in the tub could have been secured a bit better. I tried to adjust the shower head, and the cap hiding the hole in the wall slid all the way down the pipe.More important -- to me, anyway -- was the inefficiency of the air conditioning in the room. I realize I'm visiting the tropics, but when A/C is provided I do like it to work. It was provided by a window-mounted unit, which had a huge gap between the unit and the wall beneath it. Fortunately, I didn't notice any critters coming in, but there was a lot of gunk in there that should have been cleaned out. Also, the unit wasn't large enough to do its job. The temperature in the room was actually quite comfortable, but I was trying to lower the humidity a bit. I ran the air conditioning on high cool, full cold temperature for 48 hours and it was finally starting to make a difference when I checked out.The only other advice I would provide is that while the hotel's address is on Rycroft Street, and the main entrance (a breezeway, not a door) is indeed there, the parking is behind the property on Kanunu Street. There is a small parking lot, while validated parking is available in the Ross Dress for Less garage across the street (levels 4 through 7 for hotel guests). Since two school buses were taking up the entire space in front of the hotel entrance, I ended up feeding a meter and walking back to the hotel because there was no advance indication of where to park.To sum up, I recommend this hotel for those who don't need a resort experience, don't need to be right on the beach, and don't need a lot of fancy amenities. If you just want to be pampered, you're better off elsewhere, but for those of us with more pedestrian tastes the Pagoda is quite suitable.
Reviews.Author: FlyerDave

Reviews.Content: Acceptable Place This is the thrid time I have stayed at this property over the past few years and it is a functional place to hang your hat in Honolulu. It is not five-star and doesn't claim to be. It is, however, a clean, basic hotel with a pretty good location.You are near the massive Ala Moana Mall for mall wants and Wakmart's is walking distance if that is important.The cab ride to Waikiki is about $9 each way and you can walk it in about 45 minutes if you choose.I didn't make use of the pool or the restaurants as there are alot of places in the neighborhood to eat.It was interesting to shower here, though. If you are over 6 feet tall, you may have to bend a bit to fit under the shower head.I got a business rate for $90/night. If you can get a deal and just care about a place to sleep and shower, it is a decent option.
Reviews.Author: Goodpace

Reviews.Content: Ok stay This is a good place to stay for the work we where doing (POLLINATING) I had to deep clean the room myself!, but enjoyed my stay overall. The only thing that I DIDN'T like is that there is NO INTERNET! Close to everything. Hope to go back next January!NitzaFrom Iowa
Reviews.Author: Nitza

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for Honolulu       Restaraunt
Reviews.Author: jlwdnr

Reviews.Content: Locals only Noise, smell, service can only be tolerated by people of Hawai'i or those who just need a crash pad. Rooms, service, setting are just above a motel6 (and that is only because you're in Hawai'i and the location is great). Would not recommend the hotel to vacationers who have something better in mind. Sad because I think this hotel can be so much more. Great stay at Xmas...mall is walking distance.
Reviews.Author: byeJJ

Reviews.Content: away from the action i stayed at this hotel awhile back and its not that bad. there are more pros than there are cons. their entire staff were very accommodating. all except for the one security guard. the pool was pretty big and had enough lounge chairs. there was a sundry shop on site so you could pick up the necessities. and there was a (daiei?) store that sold groceries right across the street. location wasnt that bad depending on how you look at it. theres a bus stop around the corner, though it's quite a hike after a long day of sightseeing/shopping. we did get a car but parking was pretty scarce. youd have to park about a hundred yards away to find an available stall. we only drove when we werent shopping. ala moana shopping center is the best mall which is right down the street. however, at night, there isnt really that much to do without losing your parking stall and heading into waikiki. pagoda is on the other side of waikiki where you dont get that noisy feeling. some of which is great unless you want to be immersed in the action. housekeeping was awesome. they came in on a daily basis. there was a restaurant on property which was great. they have a koi pond that blows your mind. the pagoda is really one of those places to have a clean room without breaking the budget. great service, adequate location, great price.
Reviews.Author: fuerte_ocho

Reviews.Content: My parents stay here all the time My parents grew up in Hawaii and like to have a place to stay that doesn't involve Relatives and so they stay at the Pagoda. Location and price is their foremost concern which are the true advantages to this hotel. Location is good for those who like being conveniently located in the midst of Honolulu but without the excess press of people (and cars) that characterize Waikiki. The hotel is very near a Walmart and Ala Moana Mall and, if you didn't know, has its own well known restaurant downstairs. A decent diner is also located in the retail complex next door and a sprinkling of other restaurants abound in the area (mostly ethnic). Price is reasonable for a hotel in Honolulu. What you should keep in mind is that Hawaii's largest industry is tourism so a lot of hotels have been around for a long time. This makes the average hotel in Hawaii fairly aged, unless or despite renovations. So you're not being cheated for what you get; that's just how it is in Honolulu.I've stayed with my parents a number of times at the Pagoda. Each time, we get a moderate room in the hotel tower. Usually we get one fairly high up, because you do have some street noise (not like Waikiki but sometimes loud cars or teens, etc). Parking for the hotel tower (the one without the kitchenettes) is usually in the small restaurant/hotel parking lot below or across the street in the upper levels of the parking garage. You do pay for the parking; the front desk gives you a pass that you put on your dash. Rooms are nothing special, definitely dated but clean. We've stayed there at least 8 times over as many years and nothing we've seen has been revolting. The hotel tower usually have a small fridge, microwave, and coffee maker which is what my parents really appreciate. The pool at the hotel tower (I understand there's another one for the terrace) never seems to have a lot of people in it (usually one family at a time) but was definitely small. If you're unlucky I'd say 6 to 8 guests would stuff it to the gills. We've never had a problem with the hotel staff, but we don't usually ask for much besides a lot of extra towels, which the cleaning ladies usually give us immediately.This isn't a place to get excited about, especially if you're making a special trip to Hawaii for that much anticipated family vacation. It isn't in the bustle of excitement that makes Waikiki and isn't very near any beaches. What it is is a decent affordable hotel to rest and sleep before going back out into the tropical sunshine.
Reviews.Author: rea3

Reviews.Content: Comfortable, not fancy We stayed here for 2 nights during the Pro Bowl. Staff was friendly, the rooms were clean. It is old, no doubt, and the 2 star rating is probably accurate.But this is Hawaii, after all. How long are you going to be inside your hotel?The restaurant is quite good, the gardens are attractive. It is within walking distance of several small restaurants of various ethnic flavors, and a longer walk from Ala Moana Shopping Center. I'd stay here again.
Reviews.Author: blacksho89

Reviews.Content: Good location but noisy We stayed at the Pagoda in Honolulu June 2006, in a family room (2 bedrooms with kitchenette). The location is fine if you are willing to take The Bus to get around; it's a 5 minute walk to the nearest The Bus stop; and it's about a 30 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, slightly less to Ala Moana Beach Park. There is a parking fee if you have a car. The kitchen is great to have if you have a family and want to save some money on meals. That said, there were some problems, although they were not serious. The worst was the nightly noise level from the street outside (we stayed in the building called the Pagoda Terrace; it's possible other buildings are quieter). The A/C drowned some of the noise but not enough for restful sleep. The kitchen was minimally equipped...two pots, dishes and flatware for 4, one sharp knife, one cutting board, one small two burner stove, coffeemaker (and coffee), fridge, microwave; but plenty of small sugar ants to get into any food left on the counter. The unit was older and somewhat worn, but otherwise clean. However the front desk person was very brusque upon check in., enough that I would try to stay elsewhere next time. MAKE SURE you have the EXACT SAME credit card you used to make the reservation and first night's deposit, as they will not allow you to use a different card to pay for the rest of your visit. This policy is to prevent ID theft, but the logic escaped me as we had ample photo ID to prove who we were and the reservations were made in our names! (We wound up paying with traveller's checks and having the original deposit credited back to our card). There was a nearby WiFi network we could access but it was not the hotel's network, and it was not always on. There are two small pools but the one at our building was full of small children whenever it was open. All in all the value for the money (about $140 with tax per night) was good, for a family, but next time I'd see if we could find something else.
Reviews.Author: KarenGH

Reviews.Content: Cheap and it Shows Stayed at the Pagoda Hotel with a friend in early June. Conveniently located close to Waikiki (within 6 blocks), Ala Moana Shopping Center, Walmart and several local style restaurants. I like the location because its fairly centrally located, if Waikiki is not your only destinaton. Our room was in the Terrace across the street from the main lobby. The rooms were clean, but definitely shabby (cracked plaster, stained tub, chipped sink, tired/dated paint job). This place has definitely seen better days. It looks to be stuck in the late 60s/early 1970s era. The room had a coffeemaker, small refrigerator, microwave, sink and some kitchen utensils. Small bathroom and water temperature changes when someone on another floor flushes or uses the sinks. Small air conditioning unit, but it worked OK. Not great lighting, but better than some I've seen. Closet space was good and there is an in-room safe. Parking is included and there were adequate, but small spaces; additional parking is available in the Ross parking structure one block over. Maid service was inconsistent - one day our kitchen towels weren't touched and no new towels were put out; another day, everything was replenished incuding extra soaps, towels, etc. Staff were generally friendly; some of the other guests were more somber and standoff-ish.They have 2 pools, a gift shop, a beauty shop and travel/tour agency on site. The buffet restaurant across the street was nice and reasonable considering the offerings (with a Japanese/local slant). The restaurant has a massive fish pond filled with koi and nightly feedings are an event. Any phone messages to your room are taken by and then relayed to you by a live person, not a voicemail service. There was some noise from gardeners and other guests using the pool, but after 9pm it generally was quiet. Access to the terrace after hours is by keycard only.Pagoda seems to be a favorite for expatriates returning to Hawaii and low budget customers. It is generally cheaper than Waikiki hotels, but you do get what you pay for. I wouldn't stay here if you want any amenities or to impress anyone. But if you just want a bed and mostly clean room away from Waikiki, this would be OK.
Reviews.Author: CatMagnet2

Reviews.Content: Hotel-maybe, Terrace-definitely NOT I have stayed at the Pagoda Hotel in the past. It's a very good $ deal, BUT, this time I had extended family with me and we stayed in the Pagoda Terrace across the street. That was not so good. LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUD. Street noise on one side and googles of school kids going in and out and in and out of their rooms all night on the other side. Whew. I'm going to step it up the next time I go to Honolulu.
Reviews.Author: wannago2

Reviews.Content: Pagoda is a long time favorite I have been taking college groups to the Pagoda for 15 years. My students love the Pagoda. It is a modest hotel , the staff is uniformly excellent, the location is superb and the restaurant is hard to beat anywhere in Honolulu. I would book the Pagoda again for my student groups in a heartbeat. Dr. William Stob
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Sucked Walnuts This hotel was absoutly dreadful . Bathrooms stunk to high heavens bugs everywhere, horrible service i was with my kids and they told them to F*** off.I told the manager and he told me the same thing.The food looked like it was going to be fed to pigs.Overall this place SUCKED do not stay here or you will be commiting a sin Thank you Moe Lester
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disgusting Our room at the Pagoda was absolutely horrible and we definitely did not enjoy our stay! The room was filthy! The carpet and walls were extremely stained and beyond dirty! The bathroom was deplorable! The tiles on the floors were broken and the sink and tub were extremely dingy! The towels were smelly, thin and very old. There was a fist hole right in the middle of the bathroom door. One of the beds in the living room was right up next to the window air conditioner unit and it made for very uncomfortable resting. We even saw a roach scurry across the floor. The issues mentioned above are beyond any cleaners and/or vacuuming. For what the Pagoda charged us, over $100 per night, the room was absolutely unacceptable.We sent a letter to the Pagoda Hotel almost a month ago mentioning the issues listed above. We have not had a response, as of yet.After our experience at the Pagoda, we moved to the ResortQuest Pacific Monarch in Waikiki. We were charged under $100 per night. Our room at the Pacific Monarch was beautiful, updated, and clean. We even had a partial ocean and city view. There are wonderful hotels in Hawaii for people on a budget. The Pagoda was not even decent!
Reviews.Author: We-Travel-The-World

Reviews.Content: Smelly, smelly, smelly Pros:1. Beautiful koi pond2. Moderate price3. Convenient locationCons:1. Bathroom smelled like a dirty public restroom. It reeked of urine. There were strands of hair left from the previous hotel guests on the bathroom floor. icky. 2. The ventilation in the bathroom didn't work, which made the urine smell even worse. Also, the electric socket didn't work, thus, couldn't shave in the bathroom.3. Housekeeping took over 1 1/2 hours to come. They didn't think that the urine smell and the hairy bathroom floor was an issue. It took them so long to come because there were so many calls that night requesting housekeeping and only 2 housekeepers on staff. 4. Television and in-room safe didn't work.5. According to their website, parking was free. This was untrue, we were charged $5.00/night. False advertizement. 6. Loud banging on someone door late at night. This was scary. We were scared to leave our room.7. Our window faced the back parking lot. Very noisy with slamming car doors and early wake-up by garbage trucks.8. Breakfast at their hotel restaurant wasn't very good. All the food was cold. They charged me $2.00 for a cup of hot water. Wow.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: comfortable stay stayed for 2 weeks in september 2005, to visit family. The room wa clean considering it could use some updating in furnishing. It is convieniently located to restaurants and shopping and most in walking distance. The room came with breakfast coupons for any entree at the hotel restaurant. The food was surprisingly very good and you can't beat the koi ponds and waterfall views from all angles. Very friendly staff who always greeted me. With the humidity and age of hotel, the staff keeps a spotless, fresh smelling place to stay, away from the busy waikiki area. Recommend if you are visiting friends and family and on a business trip.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The good and the bad (but nothing ugly) The Good - the rooms were clean and were cleaned up very quickly each morning after we left to travel around the island. Loved getting the local paper delivered each morning (except for Sunday) at our door. Good breakfast at the restaurant. Didn't have a chance to try the lunch or dinner (where only the buffet was being served). Walking distance to the shopping center and about a mile from the start of Waikiki.The Bad - Kinda noisy. We were on the 4th floor side where deliveries were made at 5AM. Even being on the 4th floor, you could hear people talking below on the ground floor. The room air conditioner was right next to my bed so, it wasn't the greatest location.Fortunantly, our other 4th floor guests were very quiet, so no complaints or problems with noise. Overall - If you don't like to noise of city (garbage trucks backing up, car doors slamming, horns blowing, sirens in the distance) or a real light sleeper - don't stay here. Else - it's a good price so you can spend your money on other things (like Mai Tai's)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my weeek at Pagoda I just spent a week in one of the tower rooms, on the tenth floor, overlooking the pool and Rycroft St. I'd come back again. The hotel is a good budget hotel. The rooms are pretty much exactly as they look in pictures on the hotel website. The hotel in general is a little tattered around the edges, but the room was clean, everything worked, and the beds were pretty comfortable. The towels are quite thin, so you if you like thick and fluffy, bring your own.The pool is small. You can swim about 10 strokes and then you're at the other end. But it gets sun all day. While I was there, the hotel was pretty full, but the pool deck was never crowded. You can also walk to the beach at Ala Moana in about 15 minutes.The staff was friendly and efficient. The floating restaurant is pleasant. I only ate a light breakfast there a few times, which was fine. Nothing like having half a papaya every morning to remind you where you are! During the week, lunch is buffet only for $14.95. Dinner may also be buffet only during the week, I never tried.Biggest complaint: noise from the street. The garbage trucks arrive every morning about 5:15 and it's impossible to sleep through the noise while they empty the dumpsters. Late night also brings it share of noise from the parking lot of the 24-hr. restaurant down the block. Next time, I will ask for a room on the South side of the tower, hoping that it's a little quieter.The neighborhood is teeming with busy restaurants, predominantly Korean or Vietnamese. Also lots of Karaoke bars, strip clubs, and relaxation spas, probably because the Pagoda is only a few blocks from the Convention Center. You're also only a few blocks from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. If you're into shopping, you'll be in heaven. They have all the high-end designer stores, as well as shops in every price range. And the food court must have 20 different fast-food joints.
Reviews.Author: ol_blue

Reviews.Content: A bargain! We recently stayed at the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu (June 19-24, 2005). We were on a budget and I did a lot of research on the Internet with travel sites. I found a package deal on the hotel website (---) that included a deluxe room on an upper floor in the hotel tower (NOT the Terrace), breakfast from the menu at the hotel restaurant, a compact rental car and free parking 鈥?all for $133/night. The room was spacious and had a second sink and oversized vanity area in the bedroom. It had lots of mirrors and included a microwave and refrigerator. It was away from the traffic of Waikiki. The room was clean as was the entire hotel. The staff was friendly, but no extras - you tote your own bags. It was not a 5 star hotel, but probably a 3 star. It was within walking distance of the Ala Moana mall. The best feature was its proximity to a Walmart/Sam's Club - ONE BLOCK away! It was definitely a good deal, if you don鈥檛 need all the frills.
Reviews.Author: jt22ml31

Reviews.Content: It's a Local hotel Aloha all! I'm a Kauai resident and I've stayed at the Pagoda numerous of times without a complaint in the world. They were always friendly and the rooms were always clean. I'd like to mention one thing that it seems most people mistakenly do. It is NOT known for LUXURY! If you decide to book a room here and want to be treated like a 3 star or 5 star hotel . . . you're looking at the wrong place. There are plenty of hotels in the Waikiki area more befitting this treatment. Keep in mind that you're going to pay more than $80 a night though. The Pagoda has been a 2nd home to my family and me. We've stayed in their studio and their terrace more than 3 times and we're quite satisfied. In fact, it's the only place to stay when going to Oahu and we have family up there! If you're looking for a clean place to stay for a couple of nights and a LOW COST, I'd recommend it. You get what you pay for. And who spends most of their vacation in the room any way? I like the fact that the front desk is available 24 hours, I like the fact there's a Ross's directly across the street, AND I like the fact that Likelike Drive In no more than a corner a way.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Crapoda I had heard that the Pagoda Hotel was a popular choice among Hawaii residents visiting Oahu. In fact, I went there a few years ago when some friends from Hilo were staying there, and the room seemed ok at the time. So we booked a studio room in the Pagoda Terrace for our weekend trip to Oahu. We could have stayed with friends for free, but I thought it would be nicer to have our own hotel room than stay on someone's hide-a-bed. Wrong. I was SO disappointed. The room they gave us was smoky-smelling, old and dingy looking, and had two twin beds, not the best arrangement for a married couple. We were able to change rooms and get a double bed, but the room was equally dingy and smoky. I would have been willing to pay for an upgrade to a nicer, non-smoking room (I think the rooms in the tower are better) but none were available. Well, at least we had a kitchenette. Except that the microwave didn't work. And the hallways and elevators were dirty, with cigarette butts on the floor and stains on the carpet. We had to pay $5 a day for a parking pass, but then when we came back that night there was NO parking available in the structure. I circled the neighborhood for 10 minutes and finally found a metered spot where I parked for the night. When I called the front desk they said I also could have parked at the restaurant, but this is information that would have benefitted me more if given at the time of check-in. All these factors let my husband to affectionately nickname the hotel, The Crapoda. I know it was a good deal, but I feel like we could have spend just a little more and stayed in a place that was actually halfway decent.
Reviews.Author: kawena71

Reviews.Content: Look out for the bugs We stayed one night at the Pagoda Hotel and the remainder of our 7 nights at the Pagoda Suites. The first night was okay but the remainder of our stay was on the lower level beside the gate of the Pagoda Suites across from the main lobby. We had plenty of room for 5 people but the noise from people going in and out of the gate all night kept some of us awake. We also had some large roaches in the kitchen. They told us they have people coming to spray but not while we were there. The TV would not work properly but they eventually brought us another one after two tries to fix it. For the money, it was okay but if I had to do over again, I would stay the whole time across the street.
Reviews.Author: nancetraveler

Reviews.Content: Local flavor but a little rough edged Staying at the Pagoda is like staying with relatives who aren't the best house keepers. The rooms are mostly clean, but not to mainland standards. The locals swear by this place, at least my wife does. Everyone I met there, both staff and guest were more open and down to earth than the other big hotels on the strip. I go to Hawaii to relax and enjoy life as the Hawaiians do. Having fun can sometimes be a little noisy. The Pagoda has a very good security force who are also very low key. I have always felt safe. Use common sense about your valuables. The food is fantastic, especially the dinner buffet. I will stay there again. Locals from the outer islands are the bread and butter for this property. Enjoy the chance to see real Hawaii. Aloha!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: not one for the family With my husband, my 2 young children and my mother in tow, we arrived in the hotel (terrace side) only to find a broken airconditioner and a ceiling fan desperately in need of an upgrade. To make things worse, you can not open any of the windows. The walls were bare, painted cream which made the room very dark- even with all the lights on. It did not look like any of the pictures that they advertised. The paint in the bedroom was peeling. The bathroom smelled and the bedsheets were soiled. The noise outside the hall was unbearable. We were scared to even go to sleep. We had no choice but stay that one night and were very lucky to find accommodations somewhere else. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Please give this hotel an extreme makeover.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: hated it!!! My experience at the Pagoda hotel (tower side) was not a very good one. I would definentley avoid staying there again. The room was very dusty and there were people who lived there long term ( it seemed like) hanging outside our room and in the halls at all hours of the night and day. In the middle of the 2nd night I heard someone in the hall screaming and arguing with someone for about an hour straight! I felt very nervous for most of my time at the hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Price Outside Waikiki I live in Honolulu, and stayed at the hotel recently when my condo was being remodeled. The rates are reasonable, and the rooms have been upgraded, to include a microwave and small refrigerator. It's a great hotel for people who don't want to be in the tourist ghetto of Waikiki; the restaurant (especially the buffet) and lounge are popular with locals. The staff is friendly, if not always efficient. I have friends from the mainland who won't stay any place BUT the Pagoda. They don't want to be in the tourist ghetto of Waikiki, and love the 24-hour Korean restaurant just across the street.
Reviews.Author: ariana

Reviews.Content: Loved the restaurant ! This will be my 3rd time staying at the pagoda. Yes if you stay at the hotel side it is much better then the other side across the street. People do live on the other side because it's cheaper than renting a house in Hawaii. The staff is friendly. If I felt it was not a good or safe placce to stay I would not be staying their again for a 3 time. It's a popular place with the locals. They have a great restaurant with great tasting food gotta try it even if you are not staying there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I was wrong A bunch of us were going to Oahu for a week trip, and we had gotten a good price for the kitchenette room. I had read the reviews and thought it couldnt be that bad, but i was wrong. The hotel smelled so disgusting. People lived there and were always in the hallways hanging around our room. the staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean but nothing special. Elevators are slow. While we were there all of our friends including us had got the flu not sure if it was from the hotel....and in our friends room they had found drug parafinalia in the closet. Finally we changed hotels, The Waikiki Terrace. This hotel was great. same price and it is right on the waikiki strip. I would not recomend the pagoda. I hope if you do stay there you will have a better experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay there again! I reserved a non-smoking room and got a smoking, which I couldn't change on check-in day. Was told that they would let us know if one was available later. The next day, around 2pm, I asked if there was a non-smoking; was told that I should have asked before noon. I was later shown a non-smoking room, which was worse than the smoking room we were in. The rooms, including the one we stayed in, were damp, moldy and stuffy. The room was probably vacuumed, but looked like it hadn't had any deep cleaning for decades; layers of dirt on the windows and air-conditioner; carpet pulling up and wrinkled; no vent in the bathroom, which made it even stuffier. The hotel looks like it hasn't been renovated since the 70's, which is not necessarily a bad thing, but coupled with the uncleanliness, and damp stuffiness, it is bad. Except for the room snafu, the staff was OK to indifferent. I would not stay there again. I've stayed in several Waikiki hotels and would take the bother of the traffic there before I go back to the Pagoda.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Staff Are like family The wonderful staff really make the hotel. After only going there three times I feel like the staff is family. We keep in contact with them and look forward to each visit like going home. I have recommend this place to other.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Average The service was good. All of the employees were polite. The tower is a little nicer than the building across Rycroft street. There were lots of low income families staying long term in the building across the street. The hallways and elevator were also dirty. I would reccommend staying in Waikiki - nicer hotels at same cost, and closer to the beach, and more activities going on.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The staff were terrific! The Pagoda has two buildings; my experience was with the Terrace building (5-story building across the street from the tower). I had to drive around the block 4 times, then stop to ask for help before finding the entrance on Rycroft. The staff there were terrific; at my request, even sent me (COD) several items I'd left behind. The room was clean and large, with a full kitchen. The value was terrific. The elevator and hallways were dirty. There were lots of people hanging around, apparantly long-term foreign (?) residents staying in Honolulu for medical treatment. The restaurant was delightful in its setting above an extensive koi pond. A car was essential to get around and to the beaches, since the Pagoda is off the beaten path. But it is very close to the Ala Moano Shopping Center and convenient to Ward Center. A stay at the Pagoda is a great place to get a more Hawaiian experience (rather than staying on Waikiki with all the other mainlanders).
